alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 9:26AM EDT until June 29 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT/945 AM EDT/ FOR NORTHEASTERN WARRICK...SPENCER...EASTERN GIBSON AND SOUTHEASTERN PIKE COUNTIES... At 826 AM CDT/926 AM EDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southeast of Folsomville, or 11 miles east of Boonville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Boonville, Dale, Lynnville, Grandview, Santa Claus, Folsomville, Chrisney, Tennyson, Gentryville and Spurgeon. This includes Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 36 and 60. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
